gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਰਵਿ ਕੇ ਤੇਜ ਤੇ ਰੇਤ ਅਧਿਕ ਤਪਤਾੲਿ ॥ ਰਵਿ ਬਲਿ ਛੁਦ੍ਰ ਨ ਜਾਨੲੀ ਅਾਪਨ ਹੀ ਗਰਬਾੲਿ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Jaise Rav(i) Ke Tej Te Ret Adhik Taptaae|| Rav(i) Bal(i) Chhudra Na Jaanaoo Aapan Hoo Gadbaae||7||
translation: Just as the sand becomes heated by the heat of the sun, the wretched sand doth not know the might of the sun and become proud of itself.7.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਹੀ ਫੂਲ ਗੁਲਾਮ ਜਾਤ ਭਯੋ ॥ ਤਿਨੈ ਨ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟ ਤਰੇ ਅਾਨਤ ਭਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Taise Hoo Phool Gulaam Jaat Bhayo|| Tinai Na Drist Dare Aanat Bhayo||
translation: Slimilarly the slave Hussain was puffed up with ego, he did not care to notice them.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਹਲੂਰੀਅਾ ਕਟੋਚ ਸੰਗ ਲਹਿ ॥ ਜਾਨਾ ਅਾਨ ਨ ਮੋ ਸਰ ਮਹਿ ਮਹਿ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Kaahloorooaa Katoch San Lah(i)|| Jaanaa Aan Na Mo Sar Mah(i) Mah(i)||8||
translation: With the Rajas of Kahlur and Katoch on his side, he considered himself peerless. 8.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਨ ਜੋ ਧਨ ਅਾਨੋ ਸੋ ਸਾਥਾ ॥ ਤੇ ਦੇ ਰਹੇ ਹੁਸੈਨੀ ਹਾਥਾ ॥
transliteration: Tin Jo Dhan Aano So Saathaa|| Te De Rahe Housainoo Haathaa||
translation: (The Raja of Guler and Ram Singh) offered money to Hussain, which they had brought with them.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਤ ਲੇਤ ਅਾਪਨ ਕੁਰਰਾਨੇ ॥ ਤੇ ਧਨਿ ਲੈ ਨਿਜਿ ਧਾਮ ਸਿਧਾਨੇ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Det Let Aapan Kur-raane|| Te Dhan(i) Lai Nij(i) Dhaam Sidhaane||9||
translation: A dispute arose in giving and taking, therefore the Rajas returned to their places with the money.9.

gurmukhi: ਚੇਰੋ ਤਬੈ ਤੇਜ ਤਨ ਤਯੋ ॥ ਭਲਾ ਬੁਰਾ ਕਛੁ ਲਖਤ ਨ ਭਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Chero Tabai Tej Tan Tayo|| Bhalaa Buraa Kachh(u) Lakhat Na Bhayo||
translation: Then Hussain was enraged and lost the power of discriminating between good and bad.

gurmukhi: ਛੰਦ ਬੰਦ ਨਹ ਨੈਕੁ ਬਿਚਾਰਾ ॥ ਜਾਤ ਭਯੋ ਦੇ ਤਬਹਿ ਨਗਾਰਾ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Chhand Band Nah Naik(u) Bichaaraa|| Jaat Bhayo De Tabah(i) Nagadraa||10||
translation: He made no other consideration and ordered the beating drum against the Raja of Guler.10.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਵ ਘਾਵ ਤਿਨ ਨੈਕੁ ਨ ਕਰਾ ॥ ਸਿੰਘਹਿ ਘੇਰਿ ਸਸਾ ਕਹੁ ਡਰਾ ॥
transliteration: Daav Ghaav Tin Naik(u) Na Karaa|| Singhah(i) Gher(i) Sasaa Kauh Daraa||
translation: He did not think of any tactical consideration. The hare surrounded the lion for frightening him.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਦ੍ਹ ਪਹਿਰ ਗਿਰਦ ਤਿਨ ਕੀਯੋ ॥ ਖਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਤਿਨ ਜਾਨ ਨ ਦੀਯੋ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Pandrah Pahir Girad Tin Kooyo|| Khaan Paan Tin Jaan Na Dooyo||11||
translation: He besieged him for fifteen pahars (about 45 hours) and did not allow the items of food and drink to reach the state.11.

gurmukhi: ਖਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਬਿਨ ਸੂਰਿ ਰਿਸਾੲੇ ॥ ਸਾਮ ਕਰਨ ਹਿਤ ਦੂਤ ਪਠਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Khaan Paan Bin Soor(i) Risaae|| Saam Karan Hit Doot Pathaae||
translation: Being without food and drink, the warriors were filled with ire, the Raja sent the messengers for the Purpose of making peace.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਸ ਨਿਰਖ ਸੰਗਿ ਸੈਨ ਪਠਾਨੀ ॥ ਫੂਲਿ ਗਯੋ ਤਿਨ ਕੀ ਨਹੀਂ ਮਾਨੀ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Daas Nirakh San(i) Sain Pathaanoo|| Phool(i) Gado Tin Koo Nahoon Maanoo||12||
translation: Seeing the Pathan forces around him, the slave Hussain lost his balance and did not consider the request of the Raja.12.

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਸਹੰਸ੍ਰ ਅਬ ਹੀ ਕੈ ਦੈਹੂ ॥ ਨਾ ਤਰ ਮੀਚ ਮੂੰਡ ਪਰ ਲੈਹੂ ॥
transliteration: Das Sahansra Ab Hoo Kai Daihoo|| Na Tar Moondh Moondd Par Laihoo||
translation: He said, “Either give me ten thousand rupees immediately or take death on year head.”

gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਘ ਸੰਗਤੀਅਾ ਤਹਾ ਪਠਾੲੇ ॥ ਗੋਪਾਲੈ ਸੁ ਧਰਮੁ ਦੇ ਲਿਅਾੲੇ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Singh Sanadooaa Tahaa Pathaae|| Gopaalai Su Dharam(u) De Liaae||13||
translation: I had sent Sangatia Singh there for making peace (among the chief), he brought Gopal on oath of God.13.
